intro: Ichnocarpus ovatifolius, commonly known as the broad-leafed tickbush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its ovate, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its fruit is a distinctive, three-lobed pod that splits open to release its seeds. Ichnocarpus ovatifolius is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
